content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be a differentiable function such that <math alttext="the indefinite integral of, e raised to the negative x power, times, f of x, d x, equals, the negative of e raised to the negative x power, times, f of x, plus, the indefinite integral of, 2 x times, e raised to the negative x power, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>∫</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>. Which of the following could be <math alttext="f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the negative of e raised to the negative x power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>e</mi></mrow></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow></math>
<math alttext="e raised to the negative x power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow></math>

topic.text: 6.11: (BC ONLY) Integrating Using Integration by Parts

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
